title.text: Double Layered Learning for Biological Event Extraction from Text

abstractContent.text: This paper presents our approach (referred to as BioEvent) for protein-level complex event extraction, developed for the GENIA task (Kim et al.

introductionContent.text: A biological event refers to a specific kind of interaction between biological entities.
Events consist of two parts: event triggers and event arguments.
Event extraction can be very challenging when dealing with complex events with multiple or nested arguments; for example, events themselves can bean argument for other events.

tableCaptions.text: Table 1: F-Value from our BioEvent system compared to  Turku09 (Bjorne et al., 2009) results, using Approximate  Span/Approximate Recursive matching
